meanings.definition: To engage in battle or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers were embattling against the enemy forces.
meanings.sent2: The two armies were embattling fiercely on the battlefield.
meanings.sent3: The ants were embattling over a piece of candy in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The embattling nations finally reached a truce after years of fighting.
meanings.sent5: The embattling knights clashed swords under the moonlit sky.

meanings.definition: To prepare for battle or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The general was embattling his troops for the upcoming war.
meanings.sent2: The kingdom was embattling its defenses against potential invaders.
meanings.sent3: The students were embattling their nerves before the big exam.
meanings.sent4: The embattling villagers fortified their homes against the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The embattling team strategized their next move in the competition.
